main event: A bright red object appeared on the horizon, descended to sea level, and disappeared behind a cloud formation for a duration of 2 hours and 5 minutes. It's believed to have been the sighting of a Jupiter missile fired on the same evening.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on November 4, 1959, at 0412 GMT, 1700 miles east of Trinidad.
The observed object was initially spotted on the horizon bearing 245 degrees true and ascended to an altitude of 24 degrees true before disappearing behind a cloud formation.
The report suggests that the observed object was likely the result of a Jupiter missile test fired on the same evening.
The sighting was made by a geophysicist aboard a ship, adding credibility to the witness.

The document also includes information about the successful test flights of the 'Big 3' missiles - Atlas, Thor, and Jupiter, indicating extensive missile testing and development activities during that time period.
